title: Crypto investment scams (fake platforms, unlicensed products, ‘AI bots’)
summary: Crypto scams often use slick websites, fake charts, and social media ads to push unlicensed or fake products and steal deposits.
how_it_works: You’re targeted via ads or messages with ‘crypto opportunity’.
They direct you to deposit funds into a wallet/platform.
They may claim ‘AI trading bots’ or special access to boost trust.
warning_signs: Pressure to invest quickly; promised huge returns.
Platforms that aren’t properly licensed for Australian investors.
Withdrawal blocked unless you pay more.
what_to_do: Be cautious of crypto ads and verify licensing/legitimacy.
Stop sending money at the first sign of trouble.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
